business.headline: No salary paid to Madhabi Buch after retirement: ICICI Bank on Congress's claimMadhabi Buch served as the CEO of ICICI Securities from February 2009 to May 2011. In a statement, the bank said it has not paid any salary or granted any ESOPs to Buch after her retirement, other than her retiral benefits.

RBI: 97.96% of Rs 2,000 notes withdrawn, Rs 7,261 crore yet to returnAs of August 30, 2024, only Rs 7,261 crore worth of these notes remain with the public, according to the data released by RBI on Monday.

IndiGo's gender-specific seating for women travellers sees 60-70% rise in AugustIndiGo launched this gender-specific seating option in May 2024 as a pilot project, aimed at increasing the comfort and security of women travellers.

Government approves Rs 3,300 crore semiconductor unit in Gujarat's SanandThis unit represents India's fifth semiconductor facility and is part of the India Semiconductor Mission (ISM) to build a robust semiconductor ecosystem.

Union Cabinet approves Rs 13,966 crore boost for agriculture, food securityThe decision was made during a meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, with the goal of supporting farming activities and improving the lives of farmers.
Sensex, Nifty close on record high driven by gains in IT and FMCG stocks The S&P BSE Sensex added 194.07 points to close at 82,559.84, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 42.80 points to end at 194.07.

Dunzo cuts 75% of workforce as Reliance-backed firm battles financial woesThe decision to cut jobs comes as part of a larger strategy to manage expenses and generate cash flow, as the company faces increasing pressure to meet its financial obligations.

Government to increase budget allocation for agriculture sector: ReportThe Union Cabinet may also discuss merging various agricultural schemes into a more streamlined approach.

Gala Precision Engineering IPO opens for bidding: Subscribe or skip? Gala Precision Engineering Limited, established in February 2009, focusses on manufacturing precision components like disc and strip springs (DSS), coil and spiral springs (CSS), and specialised fastening solutions (SFS).

Suzlon Energy shares up 109% from March low: What should investors do? In the past year, Suzlon Energy shares have delivered a return of 193%, and over the past two years, the gain has been a remarkable 909%.

ECO Mobility IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusECO Mobility IPO allotment: Investors who applied for ECO Mobility Limited IPO can check their allotment status online via the BSE website or through Link Intime India Private Ltd.
Sensex, Nifty hit all-time high driven by a rally in IT and auto stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 155.32 points to 82,521.09, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 77.20 points to 25,313.10.

Commercial LPG cylinders to get costlier from today, price hiked by Rs 39The price of commercial LPG cylinders has been increased nationwide, with a Rs 39 hike in Delhi for a 19 kg cylinder, now priced at Rs 1,691.50 as of September 1.
Lok Sabha polls, reduced spending: RBI Governor's reasons for Q1 GDP fallIndia's GDP growth slowed to 6.7 per cent in the April-June quarter, down from 8.2 per cent a year ago.

JP Morgan and ISG partner to bring ONDC seller app at Global Fintech Fest 2024The partnership creates a 'one stop shop' solution for digital commerce by leveraging ISG's ONDC tech stack, powered by its ecosystem partner Protean, and the banking capabilities of JP Morgan in India.

India's IPO frenzy: Why companies are rushing to go publicIn the first half of 2024, while global IPO markets cooled, India's IPO market has been on fire, bucking the trend seen in the US, Japan, and even China.

India's Q1 GDP grows at 6.7%, lowest in 5 quartersQ1 GDP growth: While the 6.7% growth is broadly in line with what experts had estimated, it falls short of the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) projection of 7.2% for the same period.
ITR e-verification: You will have to pay penalty if...If you miss the 30-day window to e-verify, the date you finally verify your ITR will be considered as the filing date.
Explained: Why Reliance's bonus issue left brokerages unimpressedIt may be noted that there was no word on the potential listing of RIL's two key businesses—Reliance Jio and Reliance Retail.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Sandip Ghosh, ex-principal of Kolkata's RG Kar hospital, arrested by CBISandip Ghosh has been arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) for his alleged involvement in the financial irregularities in Kolkata's RG Kar hospital.

Sebi chief was drawing salary from ICICI, Congress alleges, bank denies claimThe Congress claimed that Madhabi Puri Buch received an income of Rs 16.8 crore from ICICI since joining Sebi in 2017, which is 5.09 times her Sebi income of Rs 3.3 crore during the same period.

Manisha Ramadass makes history with badminton bronze in Paris India's Manisha Ramadass secured the bronze medal in the women's singles SU5 category at the 2024 Paralympics after beating Denmark's Cathrine Rosengren in straight games.

Religious sentiments can't be hurt: Government sources after 'Emergency' delayedThe film, in which actor-turned-politician Kangana Ranaut is playing the role of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, was slated to be released on September 6. However, its release date, deferred several times earlier, has been postponed again.

Can skincare therapy really improve your mental health?Skincare is more than just applying a few products on your skin to achieve that flawless glow. It can have a significant impact on your mental well-being.

Weeks after music video with Salman Khan, shots fired at AP Dhillon's Canada homeThe Lawrence Bishnoi gang has claimed responsibility for the shooting outside Punjabi singer AP Dhillon's house in Canada. The attack comes weeks after Dhillon released a music video, featuring actor Salman Khan.

Melania hates Donald Trump, wants Harris to win, says Trump's ex-aideAnthony Scaramucci, Donald Trump's former aide at the White House, claims that Melania Trump hates her husband, and is secretly supporting Democratic candidate Kamala Harris. Scaramucci was fired by Trump just after 11 days as his Communications Director.

Vande Bharat Sleeper Express features promise better comfort, safety, and moreRailway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw shared a closer look at the features of the Vande Bharat Sleeper Express in an X thread, highlighting its focus on comfort, safety, and advanced design for long-distance travel.
Pics: Deepika's pregnancy shoot with Ranveer is all about that joyDeepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh's pregnancy photoshoot is here. The couple look stunning in the black-and-white images.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

IIT graduate, gold in Paralympics: Nitesh Kumar living India's dream in ParisIndia's Nitesh Kumar clinched India's first badminton medal in the Paris Paralympics on Monday, September 2. Nitesh won gold after beating Great Britain's Daniel Bethell in straight games in men's singles SL3.

How Priyanka Gandhi's 'Ladki Hoon' slogan boomeranged with Simi Rose expulsionAmid the row over the Hema Committee report in Kerala, the Congress expelled Simi Rose Bell John for alleging that a similar 'casting couch' set-up existed in the party. Priyanka Gandhi's 'Ladki Hoon, Lad Sakti Hoon' slogan boomeranged at the Congress, with the BJP saying, "Ladki ko hi expel kar do".
Rs 8k to 80k, how young dogwalkers are earning big bucks to help busy pet parentsDogwalkers are making the life of busy pet parents easy, but what is in it for them?
Arvind Kejriwal's aide Bibhav Kumar gets bail in Swati Maliwal assault caseThe Supreme Court granted bail to Bibhav Kumar, who was arrested for allegedly assaulting AAP Rajya Sabha MP Swati Maliwal.

Ex-Rajasthan official arrested for providing SI recruitment paper to his childrenThe SOG had arrested Raika's son Devesh and daughter Shobha, apart from three other trainees, for their alleged involvement in the paper leak case.

Why bulldozer is instant, but not justiceThe Supreme Court on Monday heard a plea seeking to end 'bulldozer justice'. In recent years, the bulldozer, the heavy industrial machine, has been transformed into a symbol of quick justice, a norm in several states, and not just the ones ruled by the BJP. However, while the state and many feel instant and speedy justice is right, that is till the bulldozer lands up in front of their homes. Moreover, justice in a civilised society should not be about retribution.

iPhone 16 launch next week, here is how much it may cost in IndiaThe iPhone 16 will launch on September 9, so the next big Apple event is not too far away and will take place next week. Here is how much the iPhone 16, Plus, Pro, and Pro Max might cost in India.

AAP's Amanatullah Khan arrested by ED after 6 hours of questioningAAP MLA Amanatullah Khan news: Enforcement Directorate officials arrived at AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's house early on Monday morning and questioned him for six hours before arresting him in a money laundering case.

Canada's 24-hour work limit to strain finances of Indian studentsIndian students in Canada, the largest group of international students, will face financial strain due to a new rule restricting off-campus work to 24 hours a week. This rule, which takes effect this month, would make it difficult for students to cover living costs in cities like Toronto.

Should Anubhav Sinha have highlighted real names of IC 814 terrorists?Chief, Doctor, Burger, Bhola and Shankar were the codenames used by the five hijackers of IC 814 in 1999. Anubhav Sinha's web series, 'IC 814: The Kandahar Hijack', also uses those aliases. This has sparked a massive controversy, with Sinha being blamed for not revealing that the five were Muslim terrorists. Couldn't the real names have been highlighted in the Netflix series, and what is the way out now?

Navya Nanda has got strong CV: IIM professor on question about CAT percentileAfter Navya Naveli Nanda announced her admission to IIM Ahmedabad, many online users were curious about the CAT percentile that helped secure her spot at the prestigious institute.

An ancient Greek hero's 42 km run inspired the marathon. But was it real?The myth of ancient Greek hero Pheidippides, who supposedly ran around 42 km from Marathon to Athens to announce a Greek victory and dropped dead upon arrival, has inspired the modern marathon. However, the true story is more complex, with historical accounts suggesting his actual run covered over 300 miles (482 km) between Athens and Sparta.

Maharashtra BJP MLA Nitesh Rane charged for anti-Muslim hate speechNitesh Rane made the remarks at two public events in support of Hindu seer Mahant Ramgiri Maharaj, who has been charged for allegedly making derogatory remarks about Islam and Prophet Muhammad at a religious event in Nashik on August 14.

Caste census sensitive issue, shouldn't be used as a political tool: RSSThe RSS said the caste census is useful for addressing the welfare needs of people, but cautioned against using it for campaigning and electoral purposes.

Varun Grover backs Kangana's 'Emergency' amid release delay: Censorship is never…Kangana Ranaut's 'Emergency' is currently facing delays and criticism from Sikh organisations while awaiting CBFC clearance. Filmmaker Varun Grover recently voiced support for the film and said that censoring a film is 'never right'.

Rajinikanth praises Mari Selvaraj's 'Vaazhai': A brilliant and quality Tamil film Filmmaker Mari Selvaraj recently met Rajinikanth and shared the touching experience on X. The legendary actor praised Selvaraj's latest film 'Vaazhai' and called it a brilliant Tamil film.

sports.headline: Who is Manisha Ramadass? India's first woman with badminton medal Paralympics 2024: 19-year-old Manisha Ramadass won bronze in the SU5 category and became the first Indian woman with a medal in badminton at the quadrennial event.

US Open Schedule, Day 8 Order of Play: Bopanna, Sinner and Swiatek in action Day 8 of the US Open will witness high-intensity tennis action. Women's and men's singles No. 1 Iga Swiatek and Jannik Sinner will be in action at Arthur Ashe Stadium.

64 runs in 4 innings: Babar Azam's form vs BAN worrying a sign for PakistanPAK vs BAN, 2nd Test: Babar Azam's woeful run in Test cricket continued after he got out for 11 in Pakistan's final innings in the 2nd Test. Babar aggregated a total of just 64 runs from 4 innings in this Test series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
